title: Gordon Brown | Prime Minister of UK, Labour Party Leader | Britannica

quotes: Born: February 20, 1951, Glasgow, Scotland (age 74)
Title / Office: prime minister (2007-2010), United Kingdom
British Prime Minister Tony Blair and Chancellor of the Exchequer Gordon Brown arriving at the Labour Party's local election headquarters in London, 2006.
indeed, in June 2007 a leaked document surfaced showing that Blair had considered removing Brown as chancellor of the Exchequer after the 2005 election.

In September 2006, shortly after the Labour Party fared poorly in local elections—blamed in part on the party’s support of the Iraq War—Blair announced that he would step down as prime minister within a year.
Gordon Brown attending a press conference at the International Monetary Fund headquarters in Washington, D.C., April 2007.

organizations.name: Labour Party
quotes: British Prime Minister Tony Blair and Chancellor of the Exchequer Gordon Brown arriving at the Labour Party's local election headquarters in London, 2006.

In September 2006, shortly after the Labour Party fared poorly in local elections—blamed in part on the party’s support of the Iraq War—Blair announced that he would step down as prime minister within a year.
Brown subsequently pledged his support for Blair, and Blair in turn later backed Brown to succeed him as Labour Party leader and prime minister.
